dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Actually...No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry lies on a chaise under a palm tree, drink in hand, shirt, shades. A steel drum plays in the distance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: , HARRY (V.O.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was there about ,six hours, when it occurred to me that wasting away on an island in the Caribbean wasn't going to remotely cure what was ailing me. Harry sits straight up into CAMERA.

dialogues.speaker: BLACK SCREEN
dialogues.text: A LIGHT POPS ON and we realize we are in HARRY'S CLOSET. HARRY (V.O.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So I decided to take another kind of pilgrimage...into my past. Harry ENTERS THE CLOSET, reaches onto a top shelf ,and st pulling down dozens of what used be called, "Little Black HARRY (V.O.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My thought was -- if I retraced my steps and visited all the women I've dated... He blows dust off of the books.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- maybe I could figure out how I got so screwed up.

dialogues.speaker: FLASHBACK
dialogues.text: Harry STANDS at one FRONT DOOR after the NEXT, EACH ONE SLAMMING IN HIS FACE. HARRY (V.O.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A lot of the women wouldn't see me. Then, we see WOMEN of various ages SLAP HIM ACROSS THE FA HARRY (V.O.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Or speak to me. Harry reels backwards from one Hefty Mama. HARRY (V.O.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I was on a mission to save my soul. ,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A Woman In Her Fifties, purposively walks down a SMALL TO MAIN STREET carrying groceries.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry, at her side, keeps talking at her, even though she picks up her pace and ignores him. HARRY (V.O.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My losing streak finally ended when I got one to open up to me. In a HOSPITAL ROOM, an Older Woman on life support, scraw out a note and shows it to Harry who sits in a chair by herside. A Priest stands in the background. The note says "As I remember it, you were wildly insensitive". Harry lo his head in shame. She places another note in front of hi It says, "I forgive you." Relieved, he smiles. Then, one note: "Now, scram." HARRY (V.O.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hearing what they had to say was no picnic. In an Upper West Side COFFEE SHOP, Harry pas coffee with a Woman in her Mid Forties. She talks his ear off. Harry can' t deal with it. He looks away ~ The woman places her hand on his chin and pulls him right back to her and keeps talking at him. H ARRY (V .O.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I stuck it out and I listened. Then I listened harder. Harry WALKS down THE STREET with a ANOTHER WOMAN in her Thirties, who carries a cello.   She never shuts up. HARRY (V. O. )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And one of the things I realized was, I was actually giving closure to generations of women. At the corner, the Woman hugs Harry goodbye. HARRY (V. O. )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Although I admit, some refused to give, no matter what I did. . .

dialogues.speaker: DIANE SAWYER
dialogues.text: On the set of GOOD MORNING AMERICA. She glances out the STUDIO WINDOW and sees Harry ON THE STREET among the folk holding signs. He HOLDS A SIGN that says, "DIANE, YOU WER RIGHT.   I WAS ENTIRELY WRONG.   I`M SORRY."   She looks straight in the eye and gives 'him the finger.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: HARRY (V. O. )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When you hear the same story about yourself over and over, your life begins to make sense and the future becomes your only salvation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It took me six months to find them all. I visited 18 different states but I came the furthest to see you. A HAND lands on his shoulder and he HEARS: A MAN'S VOICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't believe it. Harry looks up and sees handsome young Julian in a beret. Harry looks to Erica, instantly deflated.. HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me either. Harry stands. The two Men hug, then Julian squeezes in ne to Erica. Harry slowly takes his seat across from them. ERICA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I should have told you he was coming, but I was so engrossed in your story. JULIAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What story..? HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, maybe another time. ..So... (looks from Erica to Julian, it all dawns on him) I guess I should've seen your play, then I would've Jknown how this ended. ULIAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, big twist, huh? So what are you doing over here, man? HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just a uh, vacation...never been to Paris in January... JULIAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's amazing to run into you. You look wonderful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ERICA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You do. HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Haven't been on a gurney in six months so that's somethin'... JULIAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I've just been to every store in the city, this woman is impossible to buy for... But I think I finally found the right gift. He puts what can only be a RING BOX on the table between Erica and Harry. JULIAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Happy Birthday baby. He kisses her. Harry watches, dying. ERICA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (reaching for it) I'll open it later... Harry rises, reaches for his coat. HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, no, you know what, I'll let you two celebrate... ERICA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry, stay. HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't really. JULIAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why? You have somewhere to go?

dialogues.speaker: THE WAITER POURING THE END OF A WINE BOTTLE
dialogues.text: Everyone at the table is laughing, mid-meal. Julian is do the talking as well as laughing. Harry laughs along, tryi to be an approving part of their romance but he's totally faking it.

dialogues.speaker: THREE GLASSES OF BRANDY ARE SERVED
dialogues.text: JULIAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- To the forces of destiny that brought us together tonight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Erica lights a cigarette. JULIAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing, you don't smoke? ERICA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm in Paris, the second hand smoke will kill you anyway... JULIAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's very brilliant, but the woman can not hold her liquor. Julian puts his arm around her, pulls her close. ERICA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I like that about me. BOTH GUYS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me too. The Guys exchange looks. ERICA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now, if I were writing this, this is where I'd write, 'an awkward moment' . HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Honey, if you were writing this, I'd be dead. Erica laughs. HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Never fails to amuse her. The Waiter drops the check on the table. Harry takes it. JULIAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, Harry, please, let us... HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, no, I insist. I crashed your party. (to Erica) At least let me buy you dinner on your birthday... (squints at his watch shows it to Erica) What time does that say? ERICA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (squints) I have no idea...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (feels around) Wait,' I have my. . . ERICA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (reaching into her purse) Me too... They each take out EACH OTHER'S GLASSES and put them on. Erica points to Harry wearing her glasses and laughs. HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think you look so handsome in mine? ERICA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know how long I've been looking for those? HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes I do. Harry hands Erica her glasses. She hesitates. He snaps, gesturing for his to be turned over. She hands them to hi Julian watches all this, sobered by their chemistry. H ARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (tucking away his glasses) Once again...closure. (reads his watch) So it's only 5 in the afternoon in New York. What do they do around here for fun?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Camera finds the three of them sitting at a small table. place is dark, loud, crowded and young. They're all drink champagne. The air is strained. BOTH GUYS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (at the same time) Want to dance? Harry gestures for Julian to have the first dance. Julian takes Erica's hand and leads her to the dance floor. Harr watches them slip through the crowd. Erica turns back, Ha waves. Julian takes Erica in his arms, it's clear she's comfortable in his embrace. None of .this is lost on Harr and as he watches, the smile on his face more than fades, evaporates and everything inside him begins to hurt.

dialogues.speaker: THE DANCE FLOOR
dialogues.text: Erica and Julian -- they're sexy together.

dialogues.speaker: THE TABLE
dialogues.text: Harry is gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry, with his collar turned up against the cold, walks the glass pyramid in front of The Louvre.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry walks over the bridge, the beauty surrounding him j making it all worse. He stops, looks out at the Seine. He hears a classic French song in the distance, then sees a small barge, playing the music, pass beneath him. Without warning, a tear falls from his eye. HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (laughs at himself) At the end of the day, I'm nothin' but a sap, a stupid old sap, standing on a bridge in Paris, crying my eyes out. He stops, looks at the mighty city surrounding him. Beaut not supposed to hurt. Another tear. HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (almost amused) Look who gets to be the girl. He wipes his eyes on his coat sleeve as SNOW begins to fa HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looking toward heaven) Anything else... . ERICA'S VOICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry? Harry turns and sees Erica standing by a Cab with its mot running, snow falling on her hair and coat. HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's Julian? ERICA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He went back to the hotel. HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How come?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ERICA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (walking to him) He said when he saw me with you, he knew I was still in love with you. What do you have to say about that? HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If it's true, my life just got made. ERICA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why'd you come here, Harry? HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because I realized what I was feeling for you, have always felt for you, was something I didn't understand, like a language I didn't speak... (she listens...) It scared me so I did what I do. I snuck away. Turns out the heart attack was easy to get over. You were somethin' else. (she's starting to melt) And when I went to see all those women, I found out I was never really present for any of them. And something inside me at some point, had just...shut off. That's when I think my heart gave out and you saved me. I finally get what it's all about. I'm 63 years old and I am in love for the first time in my life. And that's what I came here to say. ERICA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, this is the best birthday ever. HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know I'm no spring chicken, I figure I only got another 30-40 years in me. Tops. But how 'bout we figure out a way to make this work. ERICA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay? Okay! I'll take it. The Barge drifts back under the bridge, La Vie En Rose pi out of it's tinny speakers. HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Honey, they're playing our song.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She comes close and he pulls her in, kissing her great. A as they separate, he smiles, relieved.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The same restaurant from the first scene of the film - On Year Later. Harry ENTERS FRAME, just like he did before. " HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Langer, party of four.. .and a half. The Maitre'D snaps to attention and leads Harry, Erica, Marin, holding her Baby Girl, and her husband Danny throu the crowded restaurant. The Baby fusses and reaches out t Harry who takes her in his arms and proudly parades her through this swanky crowd to a round table in the center the room. Harry beams at the prize in his arms as he sits with his family for a Sunday dinner.
